description:
This dashboard provides a comprehensive overview of the health and performance of a Story blockchain node. It monitors sync status, consensus metrics, block processing times, transaction activity, validator participation, and system resource usage. The dashboard helps identify network issues, node performance bottlenecks, and memory management efficiency, offering critical insights for maintaining an optimized and healthy node.
For detailed documentation of the metrics, visit:
Story Node Metrics Documentation
https://github.com/Cumulo-pro/Story_protocol/blob/main/monitoring/story_metrics.md#mempool-size-in-bytes

options.content:
Monitoring Story Node

by Endorphine Stake

Add-on to Grafana Dashboard by Cumulo

panels.description: Indicates whether the node is synchronising blocks. Displays 1 if the node is synchronising and 0 if it is not, helping to diagnose the synchronisation status.
panels.title: Sync Status

panels.description: Number representing the last block reached by the node consensus.
panels.title: Consensus Height

panels.description: This metric tracks the current number of peers that are connected to the node. A higher number of peers can indicate good network connectivity, ensuring a healthy and distributed exchange of information. However, monitoring the number of peers is essential to detect if there are too few (which might signal network partition or connectivity issues) or too many (which could lead to resource strain on the node). Maintaining an optimal number of peers ensures efficient block propagation, consensus participation, and overall network performance.
panels.title: Number of Peers

panels.description: This metric shows the cumulative size of the blockchain as it grows over time, accounting for all blocks, transactions, and state data.
panels.title: Chain Size

panels.description: This is the number of the highest block processed by the node, indicating whether it is up to date with the network.
panels.title: Latest block height

panels.description: Indicates the amount of data contained in the last block, in bytes.
panels.title: Block size

panels.description: Time between this and the last block.
panels.title: Consensus block interval

panels.description: This metric shows the voting power (stake) that absent validators represent. A high power of absent validators can have a negative impact on the security and decentralization of the network, as it reduces the available consensus power. Value: total power of the validators who are absent in the consensus process.
panels.title: NÂº Missing Validators

panels.description: This metric provides the average time it takes for the node to process a block, calculated by dividing the total block processing time (cometbft_state_block_processing_time_sum) by the total number of blocks processed (cometbft_state_block_processing_time_count). Monitoring the average block processing time is crucial for evaluating the efficiency of block finalization. If the average time increases, it may indicate potential performance bottlenecks or issues with the node's processing power. Keeping the average block processing time within an optimal range helps ensure the smooth functioning of the network and avoids delays in transaction finalization.
panels.title: Average Block Processing Time

panels.description:
Measures block processing time. Records the time the node takes to process a block, which helps to evaluate its efficiency.
These metrics are fundamental for monitoring and diagnosing the performance and status of the node in the network.
panels.title: State Block  Processing Time

panels.description: This metric measures the time taken to execute the end blocker for different modules (e.g., evmstaking, gov, staking) within the Cosmos SDK. End blockers are critical functions that are run at the end of each block in the blockchain to finalize state changes and apply governance, staking, and other processes. The metric uses different quantiles (0.5, 0.9, 0.99) to show the distribution of execution times, providing insights into the efficiency of the end blockers.
panels.title: End Blocker Duration

panels.description: This metric captures instances where the node receives votes that are considered "late," meaning they belong to earlier stages of the consensus process. The presence of late votes can indicate network delays, synchronization issues, or potential inefficiencies in message propagation. Monitoring this helps in diagnosing network health and ensuring that nodes are maintaining timely consensus participation.
panels.title: Late Votes

panels.description: This metric measures the total count of block proposals that the node has received over time. The proposals are annotated with their status, indicating whether they were accepted or rejected by the consensus process. Monitoring this helps in understanding the node's participation in the consensus mechanism and provides insights into the efficiency and reliability of the proposal process within the network. It is particularly useful for diagnosing any issues with block proposal acceptance rates.
panels.title: Proposal Receive Count

panels.description: This metric measures the time taken to execute the begin blocker for various modules (e.g., distribution, mint, slashing, staking, upgrade). Begin blockers are executed at the start of each block to update the blockchain state and apply necessary logic before transactions are processed. The metric provides different quantiles (0.5, 0.9, 0.99) to show the distribution of execution times for each module. Monitoring this metric helps assess the performance of each module and identify potential bottlenecks that may impact the speed of block processing.
panels.title: Begin Blocker Duration

panels.description: Counts the total number of staking delegations.  Measures how many times users have delegated tokens to validators, showing staking activity on the network.
panels.title: Staking Delegate

panels.description: Count the number of times delegations have been withdrawn. Displays the total number of undelegate events that have occurred in the network.
panels.title: Staking Undelegate

panels.description: Monitors the depth of the staking queue in an EVM-based staking system. A queue depth of zero means that all staking requests have been processed and there are no outstanding transactions. Monitoring this metric is important for understanding the network's ability to handle staking requests efficiently and identifying any delays or congestion in the staking process. A growing queue depth may signal potential bottlenecks in processing staking transactions.
panels.title: Staking Queue Depth

panels.description: Tracks the number of delegation transactions for the Cosmos staking module. Displays the total amount of tokens delegated in the network
panels.title: Staking Delegate Transactions

panels.description: Tracks the number of undelegation transactions initiated in the Cosmos staking module. Displays the total amount of tokens undelegated
panels.title: Staking Undelegate Transactions

panels.description: Records the total number of tokens that have been issued. This metric indicates how many tokens have been generated by the mint module since the start of the process. It is useful for monitoring network inflation and controlling the total supply of tokens, which has a direct impact on the economics of the system. In this case, more than 900 million tokens have been issued.
panels.title: Minted Tokens

panels.description: This metric shows the voting power (stake) that absent validators represent. A high power of absent validators can have a negative impact on the security and decentralization of the network, as it reduces the available consensus power.
panels.title: NÂº Missing Validators

panels.description: This metric counts how many times the validator set has been updated by the application. Validator set updates occur when validators join, leave, or their power changes, affecting the composition of the active validators responsible for consensus. Monitoring this metric is crucial for understanding the dynamics of validator participation and network governance. A high number of updates may indicate frequent changes in validator status, which can affect network stability and security
panels.title: Validator Set Updates

panels.description: This metric counts how many times the application has updated the consensus parameters. These parameters define critical settings for the consensus process, such as block size, timeouts, and validator requirements. Monitoring this metric helps identify changes in the rules that govern the network's consensus mechanism. A high number of updates could indicate frequent tuning of network settings, which may affect how the network reaches consensus and how efficiently it operates.
panels.title: Consensus Parameter Updates

panels.description: This metric indicates the total voting power of validators that have attempted to double-sign. Itâs important for assessing the potential impact of byzantine activities on network consensus. A higher value could signal a significant threat to the networkâs stability
panels.title: Byzantine Validators Power

panels.description: Tracks the number of validators that attempted to double-sign. This metric helps identify validators that are engaging in byzantine behavior, such as attempting to create conflicting blocks. Monitoring this is crucial for maintaining the networkâs integrity and security, as byzantine validators can potentially disrupt consensus.

targets.legendFormat: NÂº validators that attempted to double-sign

panels.title: Byzantine Validators

panels.description: This metric captures instances where a block part has been received multiple times, which could indicate potential inefficiencies or network issues. Monitoring this helps in identifying redundant data transmissions and optimizing network bandwidth.
panels.title: Duplicate Block Part

panels.description: This metric provides insight into how often duplicate votes are encountered during consensus. It could indicate potential misbehavior or inefficiencies in the voting process. Monitoring duplicate votes helps ensure the consensus protocol runs smoothly and efficiently
panels.title: Duplicate Vote

panels.description: Total power of all validators.
panels.title: Validators power

panels.description: It measures the total voting power (stake) of validators that are absent in the network consensus process with the chain_id=âiliad-0â.This metric indicates the total amount of consensus power (in terms of stake) that has been lost due to the absence of certain validators. It is crucial to assess the impact that the absence of these validators has on the security and stability of the network, as more absent voting power can weaken the consensus of the blockchain.
panels.title: Total Power of Missing Validators

panels.description: VoteExtensionReceiveCount is the number of vote extensions received by this node. The metric is annotated by the status of the vote extension from the application, either 'accepted' or 'rejected'.
panels.title: Vote extension receive count

panels.description: Histogram of durations for each step in the consensus protocol.
panels.title: Consensus Steps

panels.description: Number of block parts received by the node, separated by whether the part was relevant to the block the node is trying to gather or not.
panels.title: Block gossip parts

panels.description: RoundVotingPowerPercent is the percentage of the total voting power received with a round. The value begins at 0 for each round and approaches 1.0 as additional voting power is observed. The metric is labeled by vote type.
panels.title: Round voting power

panels.description: Interval in seconds between the proposal timestamp and the timestamp of the earliest prevote that achieved a quorum.
panels.title: Quorum prevote delay

panels.description: Histogram of round duration.
panels.title: Round duration

panels.description: Number of block parts transmitted by each peer.
panels.title: Consensus block parts

panels.description: Counts the transactions in the most recent block. Helps to understand the network activity and the load of transactions processed by the node.
panels.title: Number of Transactions

panels.description: Shows the total number of transactions processed by the node. Indicates the total number of transactions processed in the chain by this node so far.
panels.title: Total Transactions

panels.description: Counts the total number of successfully executed transactions in the network. This metric provides insight into the overall reliability and performance of the blockchain, tracking how many transactions have been completed without errors.
panels.title: Successful Transactions

panels.description: Records the total number of transactions performed. Helps to measure overall network activity by counting all transactions processed.
panels.title: Transaction Count

panels.description: Indicates the amount of gas used in transactions. Reflects the gas consumed by recent transactions, which can show the efficiency of transactions.
panels.title: Gas Used

panels.description: Indicates the amount of gas requested in the transactions. Shows the gas that users estimated would be needed for their transactions.
panels.title: Gas Wanted

panels.description: Displays the size of the mempool in terms of transactions. Helps to monitor the number of unconfirmed transactions waiting in the mempool.
panels.title: Mempool Size

panels.description: Measures the number of bytes received for each message type. Monitors the amount of data received from other nodes for different types of messages, such as blocks or status responses.
panels.title: P2P Metrics

panels.description: This metric records the total volume of data, in bytes, that is being sent by the node for different message types over the P2P network. These message types are crucial for network operations, such as block responses, votes, consensus steps, and peer exchanges. Monitoring the bytes sent for each message type helps assess network bandwidth usage and detect potential bottlenecks or issues in message propagation. A high amount of data sent for messages like consensus_BlockPart or consensus_Vote reflects heavy network activity, especially during consensus processes. Tracking this helps ensure the node is not overwhelmed by sending too much data at once, which could degrade performance.
panels.title: P2P Message Send Bytes Total

panels.description: Number of connections being actively used for gossiping transactions (experimental feature).
panels.title: Mempool active outbound connections

panels.description: Number of bytes sent to a given peer.
panels.title: P2P sent bytes

panels.description: Number of bytes received from a given peer.
panels.title: P2P received bytes

panels.description: Pending bytes to be sent to a given peer.
panels.title: P2P pending

panels.description: Counts the number of times memory was freed in the system. Indicates how many memory free operations have been performed by the runtime since the start of the process, helping to understand the efficiency of memory usage.

targets.legendFormat: memory free operations performed by the runtime

panels.title: Runtime Free Count

panels.description: Measures how long the rubbish collector (GC) has paused execution. Allows to evaluate the impact of rubbish collection on system performance by showing how long it is paused to free memory.
panels.title: GC Pause Time

panels.description: Indicates the number of goroutines running. Reflects the number of concurrent tasks active on the system, providing a view of concurrency.
panels.title: Number of Goroutines

panels.description: Displays the total amount of memory allocated by the system. Reflects the total memory in use by runtime and other system resources.
panels.title: System Bytes

panels.description: Measures the amount of memory allocated and still in use in the process. This metric indicates how many bytes of memory the process is currently using. It is essential for monitoring the node's memory usage, as a significant increase could affect its performance and stability. The metric helps to detect potential problems related to memory management, which can lead to optimisation of system resource usage.
panels.title: Process Memory in Use

title: Story Monitoring
